docs.abstract: More than 40 people have been reported killed by rainstorms, floods and landslides in Bangladesh and northeast India in the last four days. ThePress Trust of India news agency said at least 19 people were killed and more than 100,000 had lost their homes in the Indian state of Tripura. In Bangladesh, the authorities said heavy rains and cyclones had killed 22 people and injured more than 100.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 40 people have been reported killed by rainstorms, floods and landslides in Bangladesh and northeast India in the last four days. ThePress Trust of India news agency said at least 19 people were killed and more than 100,000 had lost their homes in the Indian state of Tripura. In Bangladesh, the authorities said heavy rains and cyclones had killed 22 people and injured more than 100.

docs.abstract: Princess Anne of Britain arrived today at the start of a five-day tour of relief centers for children. The country is recovering from widespread floods, and she is president of the Save the Children Fund, Britain's largest international children's charity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Princess Anne of Britain arrived today at the start of a five-day tour of relief centers for children. The country is recovering from widespread floods, and she is president of the Save the Children Fund, Britain's largest international children's charity.

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: ANNE ELIZABETH ALICE LOUISE, PRINCESS OF EDINBURGH

docs.abstract: The election commissioner said today that voters would choose a 300-member Parliament on Dec. 8, six months later than scheduled. The official, A. K. M. Nurul Islam, did not say when presidential elections would be held. Opposition parties are demanding an end to military rule.
docs.lead_paragraph: The election commissioner said today that voters would choose a 300-member Parliament on Dec. 8, six months later than scheduled. The official, A. K. M. Nurul Islam, did not say when presidential elections would be held. Opposition parties are demanding an end to military rule.

docs.abstract: Thousands of people poured onto the streets of Dhaka today for demonstrations in advance of a national strike called by opposition political leaders for Thursday. The strike is aimed at putting pressure on President H. M. Ershad to end martial law and set up an interim government.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of people poured onto the streets of Dhaka today for demonstrations in advance of a national strike called by opposition political leaders for Thursday. The strike is aimed at putting pressure on President H. M. Ershad to end martial law and set up an interim government.

docs.abstract: The police fired on demonstrators during the first hours of a planned 48- hour nationwide strike today, and local sources said three people, including a student leader, were killed.   The clash in Rajshahi, 220 miles northwest of here, occurred when the police tried to remove barricades set up by students on the railway track near the Rajshahi University train station.
docs.lead_paragraph: The police fired on demonstrators during the first hours of a planned 48- hour nationwide strike today, and local sources said three people, including a student leader, were killed.

headline.print_headline: AROUND THE WORLD; Bangladesh Police Fire on Protesters

docs.abstract: A dawn-to-noon strike was widely observed here and in several other parts of Bangladesh today in response to a call by opposition parties to force President Hussain Mohammed Ershad to restore democracy.   The police made a number of arrests, but no details were available.
docs.lead_paragraph: A dawn-to-noon strike was widely observed here and in several other parts of Bangladesh today in response to a call by opposition parties to force President Hussain Mohammed Ershad to restore democracy.

headline.main: Strikers in Bangladesh Call for a Democracy
headline.print_headline: Strikers in Bangladesh Call for a Democracy

docs.abstract: The Government today postponed parliamentary and presidential elections, which had been scheduled for May 27.

headline.print_headline: AROUND THE WORLD; Bangladesh Ruler Postpones Elections

docs.abstract: President Hussain Ershad today postponed indefinitely parliamentary elections that had been scheduled for December.    An opposition leader, Begum Khaleda Zia, head of the Bangladesh National Party, said of the postponement, ''This act may lead the nation to uncertainties and civil war.''
docs.lead_paragraph: President Hussain Ershad today postponed indefinitely parliamentary elections that had been scheduled for December.

headline.main: Bangladesh Postpones Vote for Second Time
headline.print_headline: AROUND THE WORLD; Bangladesh Postpones Vote for Second Time

docs.abstract: A Bangladesh passenger plane crashed today while trying to land in a driving rainstorm, killing all 49 people on board.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Bangladesh passenger plane crashed today while trying to land in a driving rainstorm, killing all 49 people on board.

headline.main: 49 Die in Bangladesh As Plane Plunges
